intro: Mimusops kauki, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, fragrant yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that enclose a single, hard-shelled seed. It is valued for its durable, heavy wood used in furniture and construction. Mimusops kauki thrives in humid climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks.
